books.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
books.summary: A poignant coming-of-age story about Kya Clark, known as 'the Marsh Girl,' who grows up alone in the marshes of North Carolina. When a young man is found dead, Kya is thrust into the spotlight, and the mystery of his death unravels.
books.review: A beautifully written and captivating novel that blends mystery, romance, and the wonders of nature into an unforgettable tale.

books.title: Becoming
books.summary: Michelle Obama's memoir chronicles her life from her childhood on the South Side of Chicago to her years as the First Lady of the United States. It offers a deeply personal account of her journey, her triumphs, and her challenges.
books.review: A powerful and inspiring memoir that provides an intimate look into the life of a remarkable woman who became a role model for millions.

books.title: Educated
books.summary: Tara Westover's memoir recounts her journey from being raised in a strict, survivalist family in rural Idaho to her pursuit of education, which eventually leads her to earning a Ph.D. from Cambridge University.
books.review: A remarkable and inspiring story of resilience and self-discovery that showcases the transformative power of education.
